messages.message: Hey there, I was wondering why we are pinging so much SSPs (https://clearcode.cc/blog/what-is-supply-side-platform/) when loading AI hub (I come from the AdTech world, so theses are companies I know well) I can see Rubicon, Xandr (app nexus), Pubmatic, Facebook, Google etc. Thoses are usefull to sell targeted profile to DSPs. Targeted profile are built using browsing data and usage of the platform. Since we don't have ads and an audience that value privacy, I wanted to check if we are aware that aihub does that.

i think this is mostly caused by the adroll pixel we added https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0106JV0TFS/p1688145681381199

cc @Saurabh

i think it’s fine for this to be attached to the aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com) homepage, but we probably don’t want this adroll pixel on other pages? is there a way to configure this in Google Tag Manager? @Subash
We can definitely check around if we can enable this only for the landing page. Do we see any issues with adroll in other pages ?

based on my understanding, we’re not sending any customer data to these SSPs, so maybe it’s ok to have adroll on these other pages?

on the other hand, i think it’s unnecessary to have adroll there, so maybe it’s best to not have adroll there so that it won’t cause any problems
